page.title: 07WORK IN KING'S STANLEY
page.content: There is a woollen mill in the village which employs a number of villagers. It is one of the few remaining woollen mills in the Stroud Valley and its premises are of historical interest, having been built in the early 1800s. A number of local people work in the village shops, of which there are about a dozen. There are also local services such as a bakery and a garage also two or three milk-delivery rounds. However the majority of village people work outside the village, in Stroud and Gloucester or even further afield. King's Stanley people feel that the village could do with its own Library, and Doctor's Surgery. Car-parking facilities are poor. Most people do a weekly 'big shopping' in Stroud,or Gloucester at the Supermarkets.
